website_summaries.verdict: A unicycle with a big wheel and smooth ride.
pros: This big-wheeled unicycle is great for long, smooth rides
Many customers love the comfortable seat and sturdy construction
Quick-release seat clamp allows you to quickly adjust the saddle
cons: This unicycle is very high and can be difficult to mount

customer_reviews.title: Good and affordable!
customer_reviews.text: Great unicycle for the price! This is a hard to find item locally, so I'm grateful to find it via Amazon. Construction seems solid, it has held up thus far after a few drops. It comes unassembled but it is fairly easy to put together. The bigger the wheel the harder it is to learn, but in the end it is far more rewarding and faster and more fun in my opinion. I went with the 28 inch one myself. But be warned if you are not tall you should get a smaller size, I am 6'2" tall.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan J.

customer_reviews.title: SUPER TALL UNI!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED!! This may be the best most fun most spontaneous purchase I’ve ever made. I’m so glad I kept it despite having doubts about my ability to learn on it. Took me about a week to get the hang of it, but now I can ride as far and as long as my quads will survive. t looks very well put together but it is super tall. I’m 5’9” and can’t comfortably reach the pedals with the seat post all the way down. I will have to chop the seat post or get a different size wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Laine

customer_reviews.title: This Is How We Roll
customer_reviews.text: Had to cut the seat post shorter but easy remedy. Love, Love, Love it! Me an my son are learning to ride and it has taken a fair share of hits to the ground. Seems extremely durable! I was going to buy an expensive one because I was worried about getting cheap junk. This seems like a very good unicycle.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and made nicely!
customer_reviews.text: My son is 13 and started on the 16inch. He moved up to this cycle and LOVES it. It's so much less work with the tire being larger. We use it for around the neighborhood bike rides and it's been 100% worth it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Perez

customer_reviews.title: Warehouse deal
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this through the Amazon Warehouse deals. Predictably, it was missing parts. Unfortunately, these parts were the pieces that hold the bottom part of the bearings onto the frame. Those parts are hard to find! Once I found them, the total I spent saved me many moneys. I had to also get a shorter seat post/cut it, because it was way too long (I'm 5'9"). They large wheel size is very difficult to learn on. Once I got it, this thing is a blast! I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mandingo

customer_reviews.title: Never again!
customer_reviews.text: This is literally the worst thing I have ever bought. Every single spoke nut inside the wheel has a stripped head making sharp points. I've ground every one and it still blows out the inner tube every time I ride it. Could have bought a quality product with all the money I've wasted on tubes. Total piece of useless garbage! Don't waste your time or money!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: MarkShannon242

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, so far very durable. I carry it in my semi under the bunk because we can't attach bicycles to the catwalk. The tire doesn't have a lot if tread but for pavement or concrete it's fine. Still learning, but I can get a few hundred yards on it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good Uni, bad seat.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly, and seems to be well built. I had to take away one star because of the seat. This seat must be designed for a female rider, because it is much too curved for the male anatomy. I rode it about a hundred yards and had to jump off of it because it was causing me extreme discomfort. I am ordering a friendlier seat and I feel I will be happy with this uni.
customer_reviews.author: dicky lopez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect beginner uni.
customer_reviews.text: I got lucky and got it on sale for $60. Pedals got beat up pretty quick but we easily replaced them with some from an old used bike.
customer_reviews.author: R. Haun

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Best price I could find for any unicycle this big
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy classic style
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with this Unicycle and I suspect it will give me years of fun. Im 58 and feel like a kid again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: NO QUALITY CONTROL
customer_reviews.text: I bought the unicycle as a gift and the first problem is that it brought 2 pedals from the right side, I did not have time and I bought the pedals. now the hub broke. I call the Customer Service Phone: 702-942-3417and no one answers
customer_reviews.author: hoja

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality metal axle broke after 2 years I'm 195 lbs and I don't do tricks
customer_reviews.text: I've had the unicycle for 2 years now. I'm changing my review. I'm 58 years old I ride a mile a day on my unicycle in Bellaire Texas. The other day I took off at an intersection to cross the street and the whole end of the axle broke off. I like this unicycle because it's fast I go to lunch with it I ride around the building on my breaks at work I don't do any tricks on it I don't know why the axle broke must be cheap quality metal very dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

product_meta.title: Sun 28 Inch Classic Chrome/Black Unicycle
product_meta.description: A simple and durable design ideal for beginners and fun for everyone. Alloy cranks, Alloy rim and UCP steel spokes. Steel hub with square taper spindle and sealed cartridge bearings. Nylon platform pedals and Sun classic unicycle saddle with built in scuff guards. Quick release seat post clamp
